20101229142244.000|20101229142246.000|TR0|for joining us.  You know, there were some 
20101229142246.000|20101229142249.000|TR0|2100 entries this year.  Of course, every 
20101229142249.000|20101229142251.000|TR0|filmmaker wants to have their movie be a 
20101229142251.000|20101229142254.000|TR0|little part of history, if you will. So, 
20101229142254.000|20101229142256.000|TR0|what's the criteria for picking these 25 
20101229142256.000|20101229142259.000|TR0|films?
20101229142259.000|20101229142302.000|TR0|
20101229142302.000|20101229142304.000|TR0|STEPHANIE ZACHAREK, CHIEF FILM CRITIC, 
20101229142304.000|20101229142307.000|TR0|MOVIELINE.COM:  Well, the films are chosen 
20101229142307.000|20101229142309.000|TR0|by the Librarian of Congress, whose name 
20101229142309.000|20101229142312.000|TR0|is James Billington, and he's actually 
20101229142312.000|20101229142314.000|TR0|advised by the National Film Preservation 
20101229142314.000|20101229142317.000|TR0|Board, and that's a group of -- it's 
20101229142317.000|20101229142320.000|TR0|filmmakers, it's movie industry people, 
20101229142320.000|20101229142322.000|TR0|actors, there's scholars, there are film 
20101229142322.000|20101229142325.000|TR0|critics, and also, the public can nominate 
20101229142325.000|20101229142327.000|TR0|choices that they would be interested in

20101229142804.000|20101229142806.000|TR0|custody battle.  Elian was just five when
